newsitem.title: INDIA: Many feared killed in India train bomb - agency.
newsitem.headline: Many feared killed in India train bomb - agency.

text.p: A bomb ripped through a packed passenger train in India's northeastern state of Assam on Monday and officials feared there were many deaths, the United News of India (UNI) said.
UNI said the blast destroyed three carriages of the Delhi-bound Brahmaputra Mail near Kokrajhar in Assam, one of seven northeastern states wracked by decades of ethnic and separatist violence.
UNI said three other carriages and the locomotive were derailed by the explosion.
The blast came a day after tribal Bodo guerrillas blew up a road bridge that formed the main link between India's northeast regions and the rest of the country, injuring seven people.

A police officer told Reuters on Monday that Bodo rebels had blasted the bridge over a small river at Rakhaldubi, between the towns of Bijni and Bongaigaon on National Highway 31 in the tea and oil-rich state of Assam.

Activists representing Bodo tribesmen living north of the Brahmaputra river want a homeland within India in the state of Assam, but an extremist fringe, the Bodoland Army, has been fighting for a separate nation since 1989.
